Cuerpo: Date: Tue, 26 Nov 1996 19:17:04 GMT Server: Apache/1.1.1 Content-type: text/html Content-length: 5669 Last-modified: Fri, 01 Nov 1996 19:13:26 GMT CIS 422: Software Methodology CIS 422: Software Methodology Instructor: Prof. Kent Stevens GTF: David Giller Mailing List: cis422@cs.uoregon.edu Links Notes, Vol. 1, Vol. 2, Vol. 3, Vol. Here are the quick Tcl/Tk and C++ examples: biosphere_tcl_example.txt , biosphere_C_example.txt . Comments from a software manager at Yoyodyne, Inc. An Overview of the Booch Method , prepared by Philipp Schneider of Rapperswil School of Engineering. A Guide to Object Technology Resources , compiled by Taligent Corporation. Covers all aspects of Object Technology. IBM Object Technology , an overview of the products of IBM's object research. COTAR Home Page , Centre for Object Technology Applications and Research (COTAR) at the University of Technology, Sydney. Papers These are some papers which you should look at. The End of Objects and the Last Programmer, by Grady Booch The Design of Reusable Class Libraries, by Grady Booch An Introduction to Object Technology , a paper on IBM's object research. The Overselling of Object Technology, or How To Fail On Your First Object Project , by Jan Steinman. The Object Technology Framework , a UCSF project in OO technology. PWS Publishing, 1994. The primary required text for the course. Naturally, highly recommended. Eliëns, Anton. Principles of Object-Oriented Software Development . Addison Wesley, 1994.
